intro: Campanula sarmatica subsp. sarmatica, commonly known as the Sarmatian bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers that bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lanceolate and arranged alternately along the stem, with a slightly hairy surface. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodlands, and rocky areas.
